intro: Boeica yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan boeica, is a rare and unique plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan, China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
